page.title: 01TREDEGAR
page.content:
TREDEGAR - as seen by an 11 year old
To me Tredegar is home. Tredegar is in North Gwent, in between many high hills ; it oftens rains here. There are many old buildings which have been knocked down.Some of the buildings are grey and old looking, they have been boarded up. The paths of the park are lined with cherry trees and daffodils, the park in summer is a blaze of colour. On wednesday there is an open air market, which sells everything .The shops are not very good because they are closing down. Many of the shops are very old and been managed by the same family for years.The town clock is the main attraction for Tredegar.It stands in the centre of the circle.The people of Tredegar are very friendly,both old and young.
